before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5e8cg","text":"This tutorial requires Unix OS with \"conda\" installed. If you cannot access any Unix OS, you can use virtual machines such as VirtualBox or Vagrant in Windows. If you do not \"conda\" installed, you can follow the instructions here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":126,"length":10},{"key":1,"offset":140,"length":7},{"key":2,"offset":225,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"73AE37B4D22611ED8CD90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.virtualbox.org"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"73AE3800D22611ED8CD90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.vagrantup.com"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"73AE3859D22611ED8CD90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/install/linux.html"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1nghv","text":"This protocol shows how to use this virus identification workflow (doi: 10.5281/zenodo.7778392) and some manual curation criteria for viral sequence identification in metagenomes.","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"49kro","text":"Preparation of the config file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5o5u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3n1n","text":"Now that the workflow is deployed. In the folder where you created, there is a file named config/config.yaml","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":90,"length":18}],"data":{}},{"key":"7idnq","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vv7","text":"The important things to change in the file is:","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gf8t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4f7u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agg1n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vq0e","text":"If you want the workflow to start after the read assembly you need to indicate the folder of your assemble contigs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej312","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13mj0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e65i2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89c84","text":"Note: If you want to start at the assembly steps, just let the value empty with a ""","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ev5b","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pb0k","text":"For the databases for the virus identification only ICTV, refseq viral, IMG/VR and crassphage are mandatory. If you want to add more database add your database to the list in this format","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2uk9f","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4f0n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dkes1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c84k9","text":"Note: everything in the config file could be change and if you miss a value for some mandatory item, the workflow will raise an error","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"config/config.yaml"},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"blhjo","text":"# path to contigs reads folder
reads_folder: Here you write the path of the reads folder","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d4kqh","text":"
# identifier of the sample name in the reads files (e.g. _R if the file is named sample1_R1.fastq.gz)
reads_identifier: Here you indicate what separate the name of the sample and the sens of the read (e.g. "_R" if the file is name sample1_R1.fastq.gz or "_" if the file is name sample1_1.fastq.gz)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fmklm","text":"# path to contigs folder if you already done the assembly
assemble_contigs: path of the assemble contigs","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b2mdo","text":"
# Exention of the contig file (e.g. fasta)
contigs_ext: extension of the fasta file (e.g. fasta, fa, fna...)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"30fgt","text":"name_of_the_database:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bttku","text":"    path: path/to/the/database/fasta/nucleotide/file","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cr00n","text":"Run snakemake workflow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ateit","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhq48","text":"Now everything is configure, you just have to run:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mjb8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2los","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bu3i0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbra6","text":"The workflow will do all the steps for you and install all the needed software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ms8n","text":"snakemake --cores 10 --use-conda","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jcps","text":"Activate the snakemake environment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dqup","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"329fv","text":"Before running the workflow make sure that the conda environment is activated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11vr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tg2f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5kj7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b879r","text":"And that you are in the folder where the workflow is deployed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6i7mq","text":"conda activate snakemake","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Viruses identification in metagenomes
